p: In the older child and young adolescent, the atypical pneumonias, Mycoplasma and Chlamydia, become more prevalent and viral causes less common. Rare bacterial pneumonias can occur with animal contact and include: Francisella tularensis (rabbits); Chlamydia psittaci (parrots and birds); Coxiella burnetii (sheep); and Salmonella choleraesuis (pigs). Children with congenital anatomical defects, immunodeficiencies, and genetic disorders are at increased risk for bacterial, viral and fungal pneumonia.
